H^".ir^^V^o,;yy3 Government.)P. 1141, 0 A B I II T.TREATY OF PEACE WITH TURKEY.iRBO0PNITIOU OF gggggg PROTECTORATE OVER MOROCCO AM) TUNIS.Oopy of letter from Sir Mauri oe Hankoy to Mr*H*VNMalkln, (Circulated" for information with referenoo to CP.1067)50HFIDENTIAL. HOTEL ROYAL, San Remo.21st April, 1920.My dear Malic in,During the discussion at the Supreme Council on the subject of gypt, the Soudan, and Cyprus, the French Delega-tion brought forward the questions in their letter of April 8, 1920, on the subject of the recognition of the French Protectorate over Morocco and Tunis.The two following Articles, tho first of which contains a small verbal alteration from the original French drafts were agreed to:-1. La Turquie roconnait lo protoctorat do la France au Maroc ot en accopte toutes les consequences. Les marchandises marocaines a 1'entree en Turquio seront soumises au meme regime que les marchandises franealses. Cette reconnaissance prondra effect k dater du 30 Mars 1912.II. La Turquie reconnait le protectorat do la France \ sur la Tunisie et en accepte toutes les consequences. Les marchandise tunisiennes a 1'entrde en Turquie soront soumisos au mome regime quo les marchandises francaisos. Cotte reconnaissance prendra effect k dater du 12 Mai 1881.Yours sincerely, (Sgd) M. P. A.HAM3Y.W. Malkin, Esq.,British Representative on the Drafting Committee.
